tips.summary: Normal mode is home (Esc gets you there)
details: Most commands work in Normal mode
Use Esc (or Ctrl-[) to leave Insert/Visual

tips.summary: Move by character with h/j/k/l
details: h left j down k up l right
Counts work: 5j moves 5 lines

tips.summary: Use counts to go faster
details: Most motions accept a numeric prefix
Examples: 5j, 3w, 10G

tips.summary: Move by word with w/b/e
details: w next word start, b previous word start, e word end
Try: 3w to jump three words

tips.summary: Move by WORD with W/B/E
details: WORDs are whitespace-separated (punctuation stays attached)
Great for paths or long tokens

tips.summary: Jump to the end of the previous word
details: ge → Moves the cursor to the end of the previous word.
gE → Moves the cursor to the end of the previous WORD (includes punctuation).

tips.summary: Jump within a line with 0, ^, and $
details: 0 start of line, ^ first non-blank, $ end of line
^ is gold in indented code

tips.summary: Wrapped lines: use g0 / g^ / g$
details: g0 start of screen line, g^ first non-blank screen line, g$ end of screen line
Useful with soft wraps

tips.summary: Go to first non-blank on next/prev line with + and -
details: + moves to first non-blank next line
- moves to first non-blank previous line

tips.summary: Go to last non-blank character with g_
details: g_ moves to the last non-whitespace char on the line
Nice for editing trailing ) ; } etc.

tips.summary: Go to a specific column with |
details: 80| goes to column 80
Useful for line-length checks

tips.summary: Go to a specific line with gg / G
details: gg first line, G last line
Use 42G to jump to line 42

tips.summary: Show file info with Ctrl-g
details: Shows file name, line/col, and % through file
Nice quick orientation

tips.summary: Move to screen top/middle/bottom with H/M/L
details: H top visible line, M middle, L bottom
Fast viewport navigation

tips.summary: Scroll half a page with Ctrl-d / Ctrl-u
details: Ctrl-d down half-screen, Ctrl-u up half-screen
Cursor moves with the window

tips.summary: Scroll a full page with Ctrl-f / Ctrl-b
details: Ctrl-f forward (down), Ctrl-b back (up)
Good for big scans

tips.summary: Scroll without moving the cursor with Ctrl-e / Ctrl-y
details: Ctrl-e scroll window down one line, Ctrl-y up one line
Cursor stays on the same text

tips.summary: Recenter/top/bottom the cursor line with zz / zt / zb
details: zz centers, zt puts cursor line at top, zb at bottom
Great after big jumps

tips.summary: Keep search jumps centered with nzz / Nzz
details: After searching, use nzz to jump and recenter
Same idea for Nzz

tips.summary: Jump by paragraphs with { and }
details: { previous paragraph, } next paragraph
Paragraphs are separated by blank lines

tips.summary: Jump by sentences with ( and )
details: ( previous sentence, ) next sentence
More useful in prose/comments than code

tips.summary: Jump to matching pairs with %
details: On (), {}, [], press % to jump to the match
Huge for braces

tips.summary: Return to the previous place with `` and ''
details: `` returns to the exact previous cursor position
'' returns to the previous line (column may change)

tips.summary: Find a character on the line with f/F
details: f{c} forward to char, F{c} backward
Repeat with ; and reverse with ,

tips.summary: Find-till a character with t/T
details: t{c} forward stopping before char, T{c} backward
Repeat with ; and reverse with ,

tips.summary: Repeat the last f/t with ; and reverse with ,
details: ; repeats your last f/F/t/T
, reverses the direction

tips.summary: Search with / and ?
details: /pattern forward, ?pattern backward
Use n for next and N for previous

tips.summary: Next/previous search match with n/N
details: n goes to next match in the current direction
N goes to the opposite direction

tips.summary: Search the word under cursor with * and #
details: * searches forward for whole word, # backward
Then use n/N to hop

tips.summary: Partial word search with g* and g#
details: g* searches forward for partial matches, g# backward
Useful on camelCase and long tokens

tips.summary: Case-sensitive search toggles: \c and \C
details: /foo\c makes the search case-insensitive
/foo\C forces case-sensitive

tips.summary: Clear search highlighting with :noh
details: :noh clears highlight (pattern remains active)
Nice to map if you search a lot

tips.summary: Use search as a motion: d/… and c/…
details: d/pat deletes up to the next match
c?pat changes back to the previous match

tips.summary: Use f/t as a motion: df, / ct)
details: df, deletes through the next comma
ct) changes up to (but not including) the next )

tips.summary: Enter Insert mode with i/a
details: i inserts before cursor, a inserts after cursor
Esc returns to Normal mode

tips.summary: Insert at start/end with I and A
details: I goes to first non-blank then inserts
A goes to end of line then inserts

tips.summary: Open new lines with o and O
details: o opens below, O opens above
Enters Insert mode automatically

tips.summary: Return to your last insert point with gi
details: gi jumps to the last insertion point and enters Insert mode
Great after navigating around

tips.summary: Jump to where Insert mode last ended with `^
details: `^ (backtick + caret) jumps to where you last exited Insert mode
Use gi to jump and insert

tips.summary: Ctrl-[ is the same as Esc
details: Ctrl-[ exits Insert/Visual like Esc
Often easier on keyboards

tips.summary: Run one Normal command from Insert with Ctrl-o
details: In Insert mode: Ctrl-o then a Normal command
Example: Ctrl-o dw deletes a word, then back to Insert

tips.summary: Delete previous word in Insert mode with Ctrl-w
details: While typing, Ctrl-w deletes the word before the cursor
Great for quick cleanup without leaving Insert

tips.summary: Delete to start of line in Insert mode with Ctrl-u
details: Ctrl-u deletes from cursor back to start of the line (in Insert)
Fast way to rewrite a line

tips.summary: Insert a register in Insert mode with Ctrl-r {reg}
details: Ctrl-r 0 inserts last yank, Ctrl-r + inserts system clipboard
Good for dropping snippets mid-typing

tips.summary: Delete a character with x (or X)
details: x deletes under cursor, X deletes before cursor
Counts work: 5x

tips.summary: Substitute one char and enter Insert with s (or whole line with S)
details: s deletes the char under cursor and enters Insert
S is like cc (change whole line)

tips.summary: Delete/change a line with dd / cc
details: dd deletes the line
cc changes the whole line (deletes it and enters Insert)

tips.summary: Delete/change to end of line with D / C
details: D = d$ (delete to end of line)
C = c$ (change to end of line)

tips.summary: Replace one character with r{c}
details: r{c} replaces the character under cursor
Stays in Normal mode

tips.summary: Replace multiple characters with R
details: R enters Replace mode (type over text)
Esc exits Replace mode

tips.summary: Join lines with J
details: J joins current line with the next (adds a space)
Great for unwrapping text

tips.summary: Join lines without extra space with gJ
details: gJ joins without inserting a space
Useful for code concatenation

tips.summary: Swap two adjacent characters with xp
details: x deletes current char, p pastes it after
Quick fix for adjacent typos

tips.summary: Duplicate a line quickly with yyp (or yyP)
details: yyp duplicates the current line below
yyP duplicates it above

tips.summary: Move a line down with ddp
details: dd cuts the line, p puts it below the next line
Repeat with . to keep moving down

tips.summary: Move a line up with ddkP
details: dd cuts the line, k moves up, P puts it above
Nice for quick reordering

tips.summary: Undo and redo with u and Ctrl-r
details: u undo, Ctrl-r redo
Undo is per change, not per keystroke

tips.summary: Repeat the last change with .
details: . repeats your last edit
One of the biggest speed multipliers in Vim

tips.summary: The core idea: operators + motions
details: d + motion deletes, c + motion changes, y + motion yanks
Examples: d$, cw, yip

tips.summary: Yank (copy) with y + a motion
details: Examples: yw (word), y$ (to end of line), yip (paragraph)
Then paste with p/P

tips.summary: Yank whole lines with yy
details: yy yanks the whole line
3yy yanks three lines

tips.summary: Yank to end/start of line with y$ and y0
details: y$ yanks from cursor to end of line
y0 yanks from cursor to start of line

tips.summary: Paste with p and P
details: p pastes after cursor/line, P pastes before
After dd, p puts the line back below

tips.summary: Paste and keep cursor after the pasted text with gp/gP
details: gp pastes after and leaves cursor at end
gP pastes before and leaves cursor at end

tips.summary: Visual paste with P (replaces selection)
details: In Visual mode, P replaces the selection with your yank
Tip: use "_dP to avoid clobbering the yank

tips.summary: Paste over a selection without losing your yank
details: In Visual mode: "_dP replaces selection using the black-hole register
Your yank stays intact

tips.summary: Use named registers "a, "b, ...
details: "ay yanks into register a
"ap pastes from register a

tips.summary: Paste the last yank from register 0 with "0p
details: Register 0 holds the most recent yank (not delete)
"0p is great after lots of deleting

tips.summary: Use the black-hole register to avoid clobbering yanks
details: "_d deletes without overwriting what you yanked
Perfect when pasting the same thing repeatedly

tips.summary: Use the system clipboard with "+
details: "+y copies to OS clipboard
"+p pastes from it

tips.summary: Inspect registers with :reg
details: :reg shows register contents (yanks, deletes, macros)
Helps you paste intentionally

tips.summary: Enter Visual mode with v and V
details: v selects characters, V selects whole lines
Then run d/y/>/< on the selection

tips.summary: Use Visual Block mode with Ctrl-v
details: Ctrl-v selects a rectangular block
Great for editing columns

tips.summary: Swap Visual selection ends with o
details: In Visual mode, press o to move the cursor to the other end
Helps adjust selections precisely

tips.summary: Reselect the last Visual selection with gv
details: gv reselects your previous Visual area
Useful for applying multiple actions

tips.summary: Visual Block column insert with I (or A) then Esc
details: Ctrl-v select rows/column, press I, type text, then Esc
Applies to every selected line

tips.summary: Indent/outdent a Visual selection with > and <
details: In Visual mode: > shifts right, < shifts left
Use . to repeat the last shift

tips.summary: Indent lines quickly with >> and <<
details: >> indent line, << outdent line
Counts work: 3>> indents three lines

tips.summary: Indent using a motion with >{motion} and <{motion}
details: >ip indents a paragraph/block, <ap outdents around paragraph
Great for moving blocks

tips.summary: Reindent the current line with ==
details: == reindents using filetype rules
Nice after editing braces

tips.summary: Reindent a block/paragraph with =ip
details: =ip reindents the current block/paragraph
Useful after pasting code

tips.summary: Select the whole file with ggVG
details: gg go top, V linewise Visual, G go bottom
Now you can indent/format the whole file

tips.summary: Know the difference: cw vs ciw
details: cw changes from cursor to end of word (often keeps prefix)
ciw changes the whole word regardless of cursor position

tips.summary: Know the difference: dw vs de
details: dw deletes to the start of the next word
de deletes to the end of the current word

tips.summary: Know the difference: diw vs daw
details: diw deletes inner word only
daw deletes word + surrounding whitespace (great for args/lists)

tips.summary: Change a word with ciw / caw
details: ciw changes inner word (tight)
caw changes around word (includes trailing space)

tips.summary: Delete a whole word with daw
details: daw deletes the word plus surrounding whitespace
Perfect for editing arguments/lists

tips.summary: Select "inside/around" a WORD with iW / aW
details: ciW changes a WORD (whitespace-delimited)
daW deletes a WORD including punctuation

tips.summary: Edit inside quotes with ci" and ci'
details: ci" changes inside double quotes
ci' changes inside single quotes

tips.summary: Delete around quotes with da" and da'
details: da" deletes including the quotes
da' deletes including the single quotes

tips.summary: Edit inside pairs with ci( / ci[ / ci{
details: ci( changes inside parentheses, ci[ inside brackets, ci{ inside braces
Amazing for refactoring arguments/blocks

tips.summary: Delete inside/around pairs with di( / da(
details: di( deletes inside parentheses
da( deletes including the parentheses

tips.summary: Select inside/around pairs with vi( / va{
details: vi( selects inside parentheses
va{ selects including braces

tips.summary: Angle-bracket text objects: i< and a<
details: ci< changes inside <...>, da< deletes including the brackets
If it doesn't work, add <:> to matchpairs

tips.summary: Paragraph text objects: ip and ap
details: vip selects a paragraph
ap includes surrounding blank lines

tips.summary: Operators + paragraph: dip / cip / yip
details: dip deletes paragraph, cip changes it, yip yanks it
A fast way to edit blocks

tips.summary: Toggle case quickly with ~
details: ~ toggles case under cursor
Counts work: 5~ toggles 5 chars

tips.summary: Lower/UPPER-case a whole line with guu / gUU
details: guu lowercases the current line
gUU uppercases the current line

tips.summary: Uppercase/lowercase with gU/gu + motion
details: gUw uppercases a word
guip lowercases a paragraph

tips.summary: Toggle case with g~ + motion
details: g~iw toggles case for the word under cursor
Great for quick style fixes

tips.summary: Increment/decrement numbers with Ctrl-a / Ctrl-x
details: Ctrl-a increments number under cursor, Ctrl-x decrements
Works great for loops, versions, ports, etc.

tips.summary: Make Ctrl-a smarter with :set nrformats
details: :set nrformats+=hex lets Ctrl-a increment hex numbers
Useful for colors, bitmasks, ids

tips.summary: Inspect a character with ga
details: ga shows info/codepoint for the character under the cursor
Useful for debugging weird whitespace

tips.summary: Substitute on the current line with :s
details: :s/old/new/ replaces the first match on the line
Add g for all matches: :s/old/new/g

tips.summary: Substitute across the whole file with :%s
details: :%s/old/new/g replaces everywhere in the file
Add c to confirm: :%s/old/new/gc

tips.summary: Use confirmation in substitutions with the c flag
details: :%s/old/new/gc prompts on each match
Safer for big edits

tips.summary: Match whole words with \< and \>
details: :%s/\<foo\>/bar/g replaces whole-word foo
Prevents partial replacements

tips.summary: Use very-magic regex with \v
details: \v makes most characters magic so you escape less
Example: :%s/\v(foo|bar)/baz/g

tips.summary: Reuse your last /search in :s with //
details: :%s//replacement/g uses the most recent search pattern
Nice for chaining operations

tips.summary: Repeat your last :substitute with &
details: & repeats the last :s on the current line
:%& repeats it over the whole file

tips.summary: Repeat the last substitution with :&& (keeps flags)
details: :&& repeats the last :substitute and preserves flags like g/c
Useful after a confirmed substitution

tips.summary: Make :substitute global by default with :set gdefault
details: :set gdefault makes :s replace all matches unless you add 'g' explicitly

tips.summary: Select next match with gn, then edit with cgn
details: After /search: cgn changes the next match
Then use n and . to repeat on the next ones

tips.summary: Repeat match-editing with n and .
details: Do cgn once, then n to next match and . to repeat the change
Great for quick multi-occurrence edits

tips.summary: Marks: m{a}, then jump with `a or 'a
details: ma sets mark a
`a jumps to exact spot, 'a jumps to the line

tips.summary: Global marks with uppercase letters
details: mA sets a global mark
With IdeaVim, global marks can sync with IDE bookmarks via :set ideamarks

tips.summary: List marks with :marks
details: :marks lists marks in the current buffer
Great when juggling multiple locations

tips.summary: Jump list navigation with Ctrl-o and Ctrl-i
details: Ctrl-o goes back in jump history
Ctrl-i goes forward

tips.summary: Navigate the change list with g; and g,
details: g; jumps to an older change location
g, jumps forward to a newer change

tips.summary: List change locations with :changes
details: :changes shows the change list for the buffer
Pairs well with g; and g,

tips.summary: Jump to the last change with `.
details: `. jumps to the exact position of the last change
' . jumps to the line of the last change

tips.summary: Jump to start/end of last change or yank with '[ and ']'
details: '[ goes to the start, '] goes to the end
Super helpful after big edits

tips.summary: Record a macro with q{reg} and stop with q
details: qa starts recording into register a
Press q again to stop

tips.summary: Replay macros with @{reg} and @@
details: @a runs macro a once (10@a runs it ten times)
@@ repeats the last executed macro

tips.summary: IdeaVim superpower: run IntelliJ actions with :action
details: :action ReformatCode runs an IDE action
Use :actionlist to browse actions by keyword

tips.summary: Search action IDs with :actionlist {query}
details: :actionlist git filters actions matching "git"
Great for finding IDs to map

tips.summary: Discover action IDs with :set trackactionids
details: :set trackactionids shows the ID of actions you invoke in the IDE
Then map them with <Action>(...)

tips.summary: Prefer <Action>(...) mappings in ~/.ideavimrc
details: Example: map <leader>r <Action>(ReformatCode)
Often more reliable than :action ...<CR>

tips.summary: Customize IdeaVim via ~/.ideavimrc
details: Put your mappings/settings in ~/.ideavimrc
Tip: you can also add: source ~/.vimrc

tips.summary: Reload your config with :source ~/.ideavimrc
details: After editing ~/.ideavimrc, run :source ~/.ideavimrc
Or run the IDE action "Reload VimRc" if available

tips.summary: Resolve key conflicts in Editor | Vim settings
details: In JetBrains settings, choose whether a shortcut is handled by Vim or the IDE
Helps when a key "does nothing"

tips.summary: Make search feel "pro" with :set options
details: :set hlsearch incsearch shows matches while typing
:set ignorecase smartcase makes case smarter
:set wrapscan makes search wrap around file

tips.summary: Show pending keys with :set showcmd
details: :set showcmd shows partial commands (like d2w) in the status bar
Great while learning

tips.summary: Show current mode with :set showmode
details: :set showmode shows NORMAL/INSERT/VISUAL in the status bar
Helpful when focus changes

tips.summary: Make mappings feel snappy with :set timeoutlen
details: :set timeoutlen=400 (example) reduces delay for multi-key mappings
Useful with <leader> combos

tips.summary: Control mapping timeouts with :set timeout
details: :set timeout enables timeouts for mapped sequences
If you hate delays, keep it on + tune timeoutlen

tips.summary: Tune what counts as a "word" with :set iskeyword
details: :set iskeyword+=- treats foo-bar as one word for w/b/*
Great for CSS, flags, kebab-case

tips.summary: Teach % more pairs with :set matchpairs
details: :set matchpairs+=<:> lets % jump between < and >
Helpful for generics and angle pairs

tips.summary: Change Ctrl-d/Ctrl-u jump size with :set scroll
details: :set scroll=15 changes how many lines Ctrl-u/Ctrl-d scroll
Tune for your monitor size

tips.summary: Keep context visible with :set scrolloff
details: :set scrolloff=5 keeps 5 lines of context above/below the cursor
Great for reading while moving

tips.summary: Keep horizontal context with :set sidescrolloff
details: :set sidescrolloff=8 keeps columns visible when moving sideways
Nice for long lines

tips.summary: Stop beeps with :set visualbell
details: :set visualbell prevents audible beeps on errors
Better for focus

tips.summary: Toggle line numbers (and relative numbers)
details: :set number / :set nonumber
:set relativenumber / :set norelativenumber

tips.summary: Show invisible whitespace with :set list
details: :set list shows tabs/trailing spaces (IDE display)
:set nolist hides it

tips.summary: Toggle soft wraps with :set wrap
details: :set wrap enables soft wrap, :set nowrap disables it
Pairs well with g0/g$/gj/gk

tips.summary: Add a visual guide column with :set colorcolumn
details: :set colorcolumn=80 adds a guide at 80 (or any column)
Handy for style limits

tips.summary: Highlight the current line with :set cursorline
details: :set cursorline highlights the cursor line
:set nocursorline turns it off

tips.summary: Default to system clipboard + IDE paste with :set clipboard
details: :set clipboard=unnamedplus,ideaput
unnamedplus uses + by default; ideaput uses IDE paste behavior

tips.summary: Make :w run "Save All" with :set ideawrite
details: :set ideawrite=all makes :w behave like :wa (Save All)
Useful for format-on-save tooling

tips.summary: Use IntelliJ Smart Join with :set ideajoin
details: :set ideajoin makes J use the IDE's Smart Join
Can be language-aware (strings, ifs, etc.)

tips.summary: Sync global marks with IDE bookmarks via :set ideamarks
details: :set ideamarks syncs Vim global marks (A-Z) with IDE bookmarks
Use mA and `A across files

tips.summary: Control IDE refactor selections with :set idearefactormode
details: :set idearefactormode=keep|select|visual controls mode after refactors select text
Useful if refactors kick you into selection unexpectedly

tips.summary: List your mappings with :map
details: :map shows mappings (Normal/Visual/Operator-pending)
Great for debugging why a key behaves oddly

tips.summary: Enable vim-surround (ys/cs/ds)
details: In ~/.ideavimrc: Plug 'tpope/vim-surround' then set surround
ysiw" adds quotes, cs"' swaps quotes, ds" deletes quotes

tips.summary: Enable vim-commentary for fast commenting (gcc/gc{motion})
details: In ~/.ideavimrc: Plug 'tpope/vim-commentary' then set commentary
gcc toggles line comment, gcap comments a paragraph, Visual gc comments selection

tips.summary: Enable vim-sneak for 2-char jumps (s{2chars})
details: In ~/.ideavimrc: Plug 'justinmk/vim-sneak'
s{2} forward, S{2} backward, ; and , repeat

tips.summary: Enable EasyMotion for labeled jumps
details: Install IdeaVim-EasyMotion + AceJump plugins
Then: Plug 'easymotion/vim-easymotion' and set easymotion

tips.summary: EasyMotion: jump to char targets with <leader><leader>f{c}
details: Use <leader><leader>f{char} to jump via labels
Great alternative to repeated f;;; sequences

tips.summary: Enable Which-Key to discover keybindings
details: Install the "Which-Key" JetBrains plugin
Then add: set which-key (in ~/.ideavimrc)

tips.summary: Enable quickscope to make f/F targets pop
details: Install the "IdeaVim-Quickscope" JetBrains plugin
Then add: set quickscope (in ~/.ideavimrc)

tips.summary: Enable argtextobj for function arguments (ia/aa)
details: Plug 'vim-scripts/argtextobj.vim' then set argtextobj
cia changes inner argument, daa deletes an argument (handles commas)

tips.summary: Enable FunctionTextObj for functions (if/af)
details: Install the "Vim FunctionTextObj" JetBrains plugin
Then add: set functiontextobj
dif deletes inside function, yaf yanks around function

tips.summary: Enable Mini.ai for "any quotes/brackets" objects
details: In ~/.ideavimrc: set mini-ai
ciq changes inside any quotes, dab deletes around any bracket pair

tips.summary: Enable AnyObject for language-aware text objects
details: Install the "Vim AnyObject" JetBrains plugin
Then add: set anyobject
Adds objects like arguments/classes/loops/comments (language-aware)

tips.summary: Enable ReplaceWithRegister for safer replacements
details: In ~/.ideavimrc: Plug 'vim-scripts/ReplaceWithRegister' then set ReplaceWithRegister
Replaces text with a register without clobbering your yanks

tips.summary: Enable Switch (toggle true/false, on/off, etc.)
details: Install the "Vim Switch" JetBrains plugin
Then add: set switch
Use :Switch on the word under cursor to cycle alternatives

tips.summary: Enable vim-exchange to swap two regions quickly
details: Plug 'tommcdo/vim-exchange' then set exchange
Use cx{motion} then cx{motion} to swap (see plugin docs)

tips.summary: Enable Dial for advanced increment/decrement
details: Install the "Vim Dial" JetBrains plugin
Then add: set dial
Cycle booleans/dates/operators, not just numbers

tips.summary: Enable highlightedyank to see what you copied
details: Plug 'machakann/vim-highlightedyank' then set highlightedyank
Briefly highlights yanked text for better feedback

tips.summary: Enable textobj-entire (ie/ae for whole file)
details: Enable: set textobj-entire
vae selects whole file, die deletes whole file, cie changes whole file

tips.summary: Enable indent-object for indent-based blocks
details: Plug 'michaeljsmith/vim-indent-object' then set textobj-indent
Lets you operate on blocks by indentation (handy in Python/YAML)

tips.summary: Enable matchit to make % jump keywords too
details: Enable: set matchit (or packadd matchit)
Extends % beyond brackets (if/endif, do/end, etc. by language)

tips.summary: Enable multiple-cursors (parallel edits)
details: Enable: set multiple-cursors (and configure mappings)
Select next occurrences and edit in parallel
